intro: Elleanthus brenesii, commonly known as the Costa Rican goldenflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow ray florets that surround a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Elleanthus brenesii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
